events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle that occurred on the morning of April 30th, resulting in front-end damage.
Claim has been reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to keywords such as collision, vehicle, and accident mentioned.
An insurance agent with expertise in auto accidents has been assigned to handle the claim file for prompt processing.
Customer received an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the claim and outlining next steps.
Request sent to customer for submission of vehicle photos, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with assessment.
Customer provided all requested documentation including photos of damaged vehicle, police report, and mechanic’s repair quote.
Claims investigator has commenced review of submitted evidence and police report to assess liability and damage extent.
Investigation concluded with findings confirming the customer’s vehicle was not at fault and damage assessment verified.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement has been proposed to the customer for approval.
Customer responded positively expressing satisfaction with the prompt handling and fair settlement offer.
Claims department approved the settlement and authorized payment based on the investigation and customer agreement.
Payment was issued to the customer to cover the approved repair costs and additional expenses per the settlement terms.
The claim file for the auto accident was formally closed after successful payment and confirmation from the customer.
